skillTree.localised_description: Egmond is a talented alchemist, learning mixing potions and ingredients from a very young age on the buzzling market of Marienburg's Potion Square.

skillTree.localised_description: No other house has more connections in Cathay as House Den Euwe, having longstanding relations with merchants from Hanyu to Beichai. The result is a steady stream of valuable Eastern Oddities.

skillTree.localised_description: Nipponese Nobles often pay tribute to their mythical God Orange Simca by offering it the colourfully painted skulls of their own ancestors. The more frivolous, the more boons.

factionEffects.localised_description: On a desperate attempt to prevent House Den Euwe's bankruptcy, Egmond scours the Cathayan shores in search of trade - all he finds however, is the watchful gaze of Tsien-Tsin, corrupting him with visions of false knowledge.

effects.description: Stance

Winds of Magic power reserve: +3 per turn
	(all armies)
Grimoires: 5 per turn
Convert mortal men to Tzeentch units using the warband upgrade system (Requires DLC)
Send trade convoys across the world via the Gilded Route and navigate risks en route to reap great financial rewards
Has access to Changing of the Ways

items.colour_text: Not long after Egmond den Euwe arrived in Cathay, coming from the familiar streets of Marienburg's Handelaarsmarkt, he stumbled upon a robed vendor. This merchant convinced Egmond to trade a Den Euwe heirloom for this bejeweld amulet. Egmond, schooled in jewelry in true Den Euwe fashion, the young merchant recognized this amulet's worth. Solid gold with a completely smooth eye made out of solid marble. After the trade, Egmond did not remove the trinket from his neck once. The longer he wears it, the firmer the rumour spreads amongst his men - that the eye watches you and followes all movement it feasts it's vision on.

effects.description:
Tzeentch corruption: +2
	(local province)
Ability: "Tsien-Tsin's Gaze"

items.colour_text: On his travels, Egmond met with a young Nipponese merchant named Himari Yamada. Like the Den Euwe offspring, she too hails from the mysterious isles. She states she we was part of a noble line living on the island of the Tower of the Rising Sun. This region is famous for it's rice bowls, not just a culinary tradition of Nippon, it has far reaching utilities including invigorating and motivating friendly troops. In exchange for safety, she offers to share her secret recipe.

effects.description:
Growth: +15
	(local province)

Ability: "Nipponese Rice Bowl"
	(all units in army)

items.colour_text: Son to Lady Katsi Okumoto the young Egmond wields the Okumoto's heirloom. A thin long blade known by the Nipponese as a katana. Forged by these mysterious island dwellers, the katana blade is said to be even lighter than Elven blades. Allowing the wielder to swing with verocious speed without losing precision. The heirloom is engraved with dragons and exotic symbols, making it a true sight to behold. It's beauty only matched by it's deadliness.

effects.description: Enables magical attacks
Ability: "Okumoto's Katana"

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Young, ambitious, gifted with magic and talented with words. Egmond is ready to sail the four corners and establish his family name, among other things he seeks to establish.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +10%

	(all units in army)
Spell: "Blue Fire of Tsien-Tsin"
